articles.author: Olivia Kumwenda-Mtambo
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said on Sunday that an independent inquiry has found no evidence that a Russian ship had collected weapons from the country late last year destined for Russia.
articles.title: South Africa says inquiry found no evidence of arms shipment to Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Domestic flights were cancelled and almost 3,000 people were evacuated as Taiwan girded for the arrival of Typhoon Haikui on Sunday, which is expected to bring torrential rain and strong winds to the island's south and east.
articles.title: Typhoon Haikui prompts Taiwan to evacuate thousands, cancel flights

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Algeria's defence ministry said on Sunday its coastguard fired warning shots before firing directly at a man on a jet ski who entered Algerian waters, in an incident that a survivor said left two dead.
articles.title: Algeria says it fired warnings at jet skiers who strayed into its sea from Morocco

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Armenia's prime minister has said his country's policy of solely relying on Russia to guarantee its security was a strategic mistake because Moscow has been unable to deliver and is in the process of winding down its role in the wider region.
articles.title: Armenian PM says depending solely on Russia for security was 'strategic mistake'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Sudanese army staged a large scale attack on its paramilitary rival's supply routes on Sunday, eyewitnesses said, as its leader appeared to reject a negotiated solution.
articles.title: Sudan's army launches strikes to cut off paramilitary's supply routes

articles.author: Wa Lone, Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: A deal Canada struck this year to stem the flow of asylum seekers entering from the U.S. was, at first glance, a quick success: Within days, the number of people caught at unofficial crossings along the border dwindled to a trickle.
articles.title: Canada shut its land border to asylum seekers. More refugees came anyway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a 3 1/2-hour drone attack on the southern parts of the Odesa region early on Sunday, hitting a Danube River port infrastructure and injuring at least two people, Kyiv said.
articles.title: Russian drone attack in Odesa region hits Danube port infrastructure - Ukraine

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: In October 1943, after the Nazis began a brutal occupation of their former ally, German troops hanged six Italian civilians on a hillside in southern Italy as collective punishment for the killing of a soldier, who had been foraging for food.
articles.title: Eighty years on, Italian victims of Nazi crimes finally to get compensation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday appeared to shift blame to his top diplomat for the disclosure of a secret meeting with the Libyan foreign minister that has caused a backlash in Tripoli.
articles.title: Netanyahu rues his foreign minister's disclosure of meeting with Libyan counterpart
